title: Math-Verilamo
author: Math-Verilamo
content: Hey crypto enthusiasts  I recently came across the platform https://crydis.com, which is an AI-driven crypto prediction service. It provides real-time market data analysis and delivers insights directly to your email daily. I've been using it for several weeks now and I must say, the results have been accurate and immensely helpful!Navigating the crypto waters can be a daunting task, especially given the market's inherent volatility. But with Crydis, I feel I've been able to make more informed decisions based on their short-term predictions. It's been a game-changer for my trading strategy, helping me stay ahead in this crypto market.However, as someone always looking to diversify my toolkit, I'm curious about other platforms you all might be using. Has anyone here tried Crydis? And if so, how does it compare to other platforms you've experienced?Thanks!

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: You do not have to be misleading people. If you want to oppose it that you are not misleading people, let us see your orders on an exchange future market and see if you are actually making profit or not. Some exchanges can also tell you your winning days, add it along too. Also you can let us know your 6 months PnL. Mention the exchange if it is not a common exchange. If the exchange is among the first 20 exchanges with the highest 24 hours daily volume, no need to mention its name. We would know. As to what I know, you want to only mislead people and using this means to advertise a signal group. People should avoid this. Signal providers only care about their pockets.Anyone that wants to know how to trade should learn about trading and have the necessary knowledge and experience about how to make profit from trading.

comments.author: Ndabagi01
comments.body: Quote from: Math-Verilamo on September 08, 2023, 07:16:37 AMHowever, as someone always looking to diversify my toolkit, I'm curious about other platforms you all might be using. Has anyone here tried Crydis? And if so, how does it compare to other platforms you've experienced?I've never tried any of them since I don't believe they work. The market is volatile; how can an AI prediction tool made by humans predict where the market is headed or provide positive feedback on what I'm anticipating? I don't utilise any of them since I don't trust them. To prevent letdown from these tools, I prefer to make decisions based on my market analysis and understanding.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on September 08, 2023, 09:22:40 AMAs to what I know, you want to only mislead people and using this means to advertise a signal group. People should avoid this. Signal providers only care about their pockets.You are 100% right, this platform is nothing but a way to lure people into their groups where they could charge people for signals which might also not based on AI algorithms. And who know what type of AI algorithms they are using because I have seen many platforms saying we have better AI algorithmic bots but at the end they all end up some API of existing bots like GPT. This is also another type of auch scams. Dear op, if you really want people to use your platform then be open and transparent to them. Fooling them is not going to get you hell lot of traffic. Instead it will only bring you temporary success. If your main aim is to ask people to buy signals by paying money then provide the details in the post. Or, also provide some reviews too like if you have any clients or customers who are happy with your results then provide their reviews to us so we could get an idea about your platform. Also try to elaborate more, like how you guys are going to use AI to bring more profits on the table while your AI will not be different from others.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Here's a tip: Want to promote a bitcoin/crypto/trading-related service? Just create a great announcement post and answer people's inquiries; like, you know — how a trustworthy and reputable service would do it? Trying to fake a post that you somehow "came across" a platform that literally no one but you knows is just going to destroy your platform's reputation.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: This is just like those many soccer prediction site that would promise gamers sure winnings and even go ahead to doctor some gaming slips.I won't trust any site that promise to give accurate prediction in crypto-currency be it price prediction or trading prediction, it's mostly false and a scheme to get people on board. Crypto-currency is very volatile and not easily predictable.

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: This is more like a shilling/advertisement attempt rather than trying to get community opinions. This isn't the first times there have been attempts by newbies like OP outrightly shilling a service that no one cares about.Also, a key point to note:- If AI has gotten as powerful as these services or websites hype it up to be, we'd know. At most, they would just lure you to join their paid service one way or another.- Anything that sounds too good fo be true is probably not true.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Quote from: Math-Verilamo on September 08, 2023, 07:16:37 AMI recently came across the platform https://crydis.com, which is an AI-driven crypto prediction service. It provides real-time market data analysis and delivers insights directly to your email daily. I've been using it for several weeks now and I must say, the results have been accurate and immensely helpful!I see a great deal of sense in what Oshosondy has said, and I would have loved to ask you, @OP, how long you have been an affiliate with that website. If you have been using it for a long time now, then you should know more about the platform so you can also take the advice that MK4 has given you.If you have compared the capability of that AI bot with your best trading strategy and you think the AI performance is better, it would be more authentic if you could share with us how success was archived, and you could also include some image.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: Math-Verilamo on September 08, 2023, 07:16:37 AMHowever, as someone always looking to diversify my toolkit, I'm curious about other platforms you all might be using. Has anyone here tried Crydis? And if so, how does it compare to other platforms you've experienced?We have alot of platforms, websites that talks about cryptocurrency and bitcoin price movement one can visit to get information from, but using any of this platforms is not a guarantee that there can be a change to having better experience in trading than what we have to also discover by ourselves, then i see this as not all about the platform being used, we have to get the right understanding of trading indications and how to apply them to our day to day activities and not depending on what is being received from other platforms that cannot be trusted.

comments.author: Latviand
comments.body: The description about these tools being used for prediction should made someone be careful about using it knowing that the possibility that the prediction might be wrong and that it might cause you some losses. When I was trading and even my friends that are trading, they haven't even tried using it, most of them of are purist when it comes to trading, no prediction tools or anything like that so it's unlikely my friends and I have heard of Crydis.

comments.author: Sanitough
comments.body: Quote from: nelson4lov on September 08, 2023, 10:27:48 PMThis is more like a shilling/advertisement attempt rather than trying to get community opinions. This isn't the first times there have been attempts by newbies like OP outrightly shilling a service that no one cares about.Also, a key point to note:- If AI has gotten as powerful as these services or websites hype it up to be, we'd know. At most, they would just lure you to join their paid service one way or another.- Anything that sounds too good fo be true is probably not true.  No one falls for this except for other newbies like you do OP. Advertising a platform that you rarely even know is like trying to form an image like a scammer. You get to say the positive points about it and when people start trusting and then losing after, then you act like as if you never encourage them to do so. And take note, AI will never be reliable in trading. At times it may seem working but in the long run, its predictions will end up as pointless. No one is capable to read or predict correctly what’s ahead in trading, and if there’s any, you are likely believing in a scam.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Most of those who try to describe their services in such a complex manner say that their services are substandard and there is no analysis or artificial intelligence.QuoteCrydis is driven by a mission to offer dependable cryptocurrency trend forecasts straight to your inbox. Backed by years of deep research and extensive testing, our daily email analyses are top-notch, covering everything from 5-minute movements to more extensive 4-day trajectories.It has come to my attention that there is no free service and their prices start at $5.95/mo, which I think is risky to try in something that does not guarantee results or promises that have no proof of them.Quote5. Payment and RefundsPayments for the Service are processed through Stripe. Crydis does not store or process any payment information directly. All sales are final and no refunds will be given, except in cases where required by law.If we add that to their terms of use, which seem brief and without refunds, I don't think it's worth it.

comments.author: tjtonmoy
comments.body: I think OP is trying to promote his website. Now hear me out, If you want to promote your service here, head toward the service section and create a thread about this service. How it works and what it does, what you need to acquire this service, etc. Saying that you have tried it by yourself and it is the perfect tool is misleading people. So stop doing that. Although I am not into using any prediction tools. But if you working hard and your service is legit, then do what I said. Saying stuff like this makes it look like a scam. It's more like an annoying ad on social media platforms that looks like a scam. I haven't tried it and I don't think I ever will after seeing this post. So as I said before, if you want to promote this, then do it in the right way. Not like this. Doing it on your own gives you more knowledge and experience which could help you in the long run. For this reason, if you are a consumer and not the owner, I will suggest stop doing this and do it on your own.

comments.author: khiholangkang
comments.body: Quote from: tjtonmoy on September 09, 2023, 06:25:50 PMI think OP is trying to promote his website. Now hear me out, If you want to promote your service here, head toward the service section and create a thread about this service. How it works and what it does, what you need to acquire this service, etc. Saying that you have tried it by yourself and it is the perfect tool is misleading people. So stop doing that. Although I am not into using any prediction tools. But if you working hard and your service is legit, then do what I said. Saying stuff like this makes it look like a scam. It's more like an annoying ad on social media platforms that looks like a scam. I haven't tried it and I don't think I ever will after seeing this post. So as I said before, if you want to promote this, then do it in the right way. Not like this. Doing it on your own gives you more knowledge and experience which could help you in the long run. For this reason, if you are a consumer and not the owner, I will suggest stop doing this and do it on your own. You cannot be absorbed that he is promoting his own web, although from what he said about the site it seemed to give an excellent review for advertising but maybe he wanted various people here and discussed it about the use of the website.Surely it is better to use the results of the analysis of themselves in making a decision in trade, such things are done only for those who cannot analyze well the price of price movements on the market, is that reasonable? Yes it's natural for some people. But it's better to use your own analysis for your future trade.

comments.author: harizen
comments.body: Just for clarification, OP there's no accurate prediction but simply close from happening. If that prediction tool you are using which powered by an AI is helpful to you, then just keep on using it. Never did tried any prediction tools before as experienced will always be the best foundation to deal with trading in cryptocurrency.Regardless if OP is shilling the site, I trust most users here already know the drill.

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on September 08, 2023, 05:44:23 PMHere's a tip: Want to promote a bitcoin/crypto/trading-related service? Just create a great announcement post and answer people's inquiries; like, you know — how a trustworthy and reputable service would do it? Trying to fake a post that you somehow "came across" a platform that literally no one but you knows is just going to destroy your platform's reputation.This is how the newbies promote a site indirectly, like they are asking about the site and the comments of the others, I’m also wondering why they are not doing their formal campaign here or those newbies are just trying to ruin the reputation of that site? Well, to answer the concern of OP, i have no idea about that site and why should I trust that site as my prediction tool especially if I know to myself that I can trade on my own and what benefits that I can get from this site?

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: Quote from: Math-Verilamo on September 08, 2023, 07:16:37 AMHey crypto enthusiasts  I recently came across the platform https://crydis.com, which is an AI-driven crypto prediction service. It provides real-time market data analysis and delivers insights directly to your email daily. I've been using it for several weeks now and I must say, the results have been accurate and immensely helpful!Navigating the crypto waters can be a daunting task, especially given the market's inherent volatility. But with Crydis, I feel I've been able to make more informed decisions based on their short-term predictions. It's been a game-changer for my trading strategy, helping me stay ahead in this crypto market.However, as someone always looking to diversify my toolkit, I'm curious about other platforms you all might be using. Has anyone here tried Crydis? And if so, how does it compare to other platforms you've experienced?Thanks!Nah, it's better if you really immerse yourself about the technical analysis side of crypto and maybe you can really appreciate the volatility and uses it to your advantage.Unlike using such apps or tools to help you out to make predictions. I mean do you really have to rely to crypto prediction tools and based everything on that app before you invest?Or just used the old adage "do your own research" thingy?Sorry to burst the bubble for you, but I'm not buying this so called prediction platform that you are trying to shill and promote in this community. And obviously, others knows what you are doing here, so it's not a good thing.

comments.author: jeraldskie11
comments.body: Quote from: Math-Verilamo on September 08, 2023, 07:16:37 AMHey crypto enthusiasts  I recently came across the platform https://crydis.com, which is an AI-driven crypto prediction service. It provides real-time market data analysis and delivers insights directly to your email daily. I've been using it for several weeks now and I must say, the results have been accurate and immensely helpful!Navigating the crypto waters can be a daunting task, especially given the market's inherent volatility. But with Crydis, I feel I've been able to make more informed decisions based on their short-term predictions. It's been a game-changer for my trading strategy, helping me stay ahead in this crypto market.However, as someone always looking to diversify my toolkit, I'm curious about other platforms you all might be using. Has anyone here tried Crydis? And if so, how does it compare to other platforms you've experienced?Thanks!If I could go back in time to when I didn't have a edge in trading, I would have probably tried this platform. I've had a lot of losses in my trades since I haven't found a strategy that works for me, which is why I've joined so many mentorship programs. And then I saw that those strategies were very similar because you may still lose. As a result, I realized that there is no way to foresee market movement, and that we must simply wait for opportunities in the market based on our analysis.
